title: PRACTITIONER) REGULATIONS 2022
heading: 20. Revocations and transitional provisions
text_raw:
20. Revocations and transitional provisions 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [282] 3 

S.I. No. 282 of 2022 

VETERINARY COUNCIL OF IRELAND (RECOGNITION OF 
QUALIFICATIONS AND REGISTRATION) (VETERINARY 
PRACTITIONER) REGULATIONS 2022 

The Veterinary Council of Ireland, in exercise of the powers conferred on it by 
section 52 and section 133 of the Veterinary Practice Act 2005 (No. 22 of 
2005) (as amended), hereby makes the following regulations:- 

Part 1 

Preliminary 

Citation
text_norm: 20 revocation transitional provision 282 3 s.i no 282 2022 veterinary council ireland (recognition qualification registration) (veterinary practitioner) regulation 2022 veterinary council ireland exercise power conferred section 52 section 133 veterinary practice act 2005 (no 22 2005) (as amended) hereby make following regulation - part 1 preliminary citation

title: PRACTITIONER) REGULATIONS 2022
heading: 1. These regulations may be cited as the Veterinary Council of Ireland
text_raw:
1. These regulations may be cited as the Veterinary Council of Ireland 
(Recognition of Qualifications and Registration) (Veterinary Practitioner) 
Regulations 2022. 

Commencement

heading: 2. These regulations come into operation on the 1st July 2022.

text_raw:

law. 

The register
text_norm: 4 relevant extract register available inspection accordance council data protection obligation irish eu law register

title: PRACTITIONER) REGULATIONS 2022
heading: 5. The register contains four parts:
text_raw:
5. The register contains four parts: 

Part A-Veterinary Practitioners registered pursuant to sections 40-42, section 
43(2),(4), and (6) and section 44; 

Part B-Veterinary Practitioners permitted to provide services in the State on a 
temporary and occasional basis and registered pursuant to section 43(9); 

Part C- Veterinary Practitioners granted limited registration and registered 
pursuant to section 45; and 

Part D-Veterinary Practitioners registered as veterinary specialists pursuant to 
section 47. Part D shall contain a part in respect of each specialty prescribed 
by the Council under the Act. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 6. The register shall contain in respect of each registered veterinary 

practitioner, the following information: 

[282] 5 

(a) Name; 

(b) qualifications; 

(c) 

gender; 

(d) postal address, email address and telephone number(s) for 

correspondence; 

(e) 

registration number; 

(f) 

registration date; 

(g) 

(h) 

(i) 

registration status (which may include particulars of any period 
of suspension from the register or any conditions attached to 
registration and compliance with such conditions); 

in the case of a veterinary practitioner registered on Part B the 
period for which the practitioner is registered on Part B of the 
register; 

in the case of a veterinary practitioner registered on Part C of the 
register the period for which the practitioner is registered and 
whether the practitioner has been granted limited registration to 
participate in a disease eradication programme or to participate 
in the provision of approved programmes of education or further 
education; 

(j) 

in the case of a veterinary practitioner registered on Part D of 
the register, the specialties in respect of which the veterinary 
practitioner is registered; 

(k) 

date of annual retention(s); 

Part 3 

Recognition of Qualifications and Registration in the Register 

Scope of Part 3
text_norm: 5 register contains four part part a-veterinary practitioner registered pursuant section 40-42 section 43(2) (4) (6) section 44 part b-veterinary practitioner permitted provide service state temporary occasional basis registered pursuant section 43(9) part c- veterinary practitioner granted limited registration registered pursuant section 45 part d-veterinary practitioner registered veterinary specialist pursuant section 47 part shall contain part respect specialty prescribed council act 6 register shall contain respect registered veterinary practitioner following information 282 5 (a) name (b) qualification (c) gender (d) postal address email address telephone number(s) correspondence (e) registration number (f) registration date (g) (h) (i) registration status (which may include particular period suspension register condition attached registration compliance conditions) case veterinary practitioner registered part b period practitioner registered part b register case veterinary practitioner registered part c register period practitioner registered whether practitioner granted limited registration participate disease eradication programme participate provision approved programme education education (j) case veterinary practitioner registered part register specialty respect veterinary practitioner registered (k) date annual retention(s) part 3 recognition qualification registration register scope part 3

title: PRACTITIONER) REGULATIONS 2022
heading: 7. This Part applies to a veterinary practitioner seeking to be registered in
text_raw:
7. This Part applies to a veterinary practitioner seeking to be registered in 

the register, other than— 

(a) 

a veterinary practitioner applying for restoration of his or her 
registration under the Act; and 

 
 
 
 6 [282] 

(b) 

a veterinary practitioner applying for annual retention of his or 
her registration under Part 5 of these regulations. 

Recognition of qualification as a veterinary practitioner for the purposes of 
registration in Part A of the register

title: PRACTITIONER) REGULATIONS 2022
heading: 8. An applicant for registration as a veterinary practitioner must satisfy the
text_raw:
8. An applicant for registration as a veterinary practitioner must satisfy the 
Council that he or she has the requisite qualifications by providing evidence to 
the Council that he or she — 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

(e) 

is a person entitled to be registered under section 42 of the Act 
and has been awarded educational qualification(s) prescribed by 
the Council 
the prescribed educational qualifications 
regulations; 

in 

is a person entitled to be registered under section 43 (2) of the 
Act and/or the equivalent provisions in the regulations of 2017; 

is a person entitled to be registered under Section 43(4) of the 
Act and/or the equivalent provisions in the regulations of 2017; 
and/or 

is a person entitled to be registered under Section 43(6) of the 
Act and/or the equivalent provisions in the regulations of 2017; 
and/or 

being a person who is not entitled to be registered under sections 
42 or 43, is a person pursuant to section 44, who has undergone 
programmes of training and education, passed examinations and 
obtained qualifications that are of a standard that is not lower 
than the standard of such programmes, examinations or 
qualifications that are, in the opinion of the Council, necessary 
for the practice of veterinary medicine in the State. In order that 
the Council may be satisfied that the standard that applies to the 
programmes of education and training undergone, examinations 
passed and qualifications obtained is not of a standard that is 
lower than the standard of such programmes, examinations or 
qualifications that is necessary for the practice of veterinary 
medicine, it may require an applicant, to sit and pass an 
examination set by or on behalf of the Council in that regard. 

Recognition of qualifications for the provision of services in the State on a 
temporary and occasional basis-Part B of the register

title: PRACTITIONER) REGULATIONS 2022
heading: In the case of an application for registration for the provision of
text_raw:
9. 

In the case of an application for registration for the provision of 
temporary and occasional services, the applicant must satisfy the Council that 

 
 
 
 [282] 7 

he or she is a person entitled to be registered under section 43(9) of the Act 
and/or the equivalent provisions in the regulations of 2017. 

Criteria for Limited registration –Part C of the register
text_norm: 9 case application registration provision temporary occasional service applicant must satisfy council 282 7 person entitled registered section 43(9) act equivalent provision regulation 2017 criterion limited registration -part c register

title: PRACTITIONER) REGULATIONS 2022
heading: 10. In the case of an application for limited registration under section 45 of
text_raw:
10. In the case of an application for limited registration under section 45 of 

the Act the applicant must satisfy the Council: 

(a) 

(b) 

that the person making the application is required, in the case of 
an application under section 45(2)(a), to participate in a disease 
eradication programme; or 

that the person making the application is required, in the case of 
an application under section 45(2)(b) to participate in the 
provision of approved programmes of education or further 
education; and 

(c) 

that he or she has the requisite knowledge and skill for the 
purposes of section 45(2) (a) or (b), as the case may be. 

Recognition of qualification as a veterinary specialist-Part D of the register
text_norm: 10 case application limited registration section 45 act applicant must satisfy council (a) (b) person making application required case application section 45(2)(a) participate disease eradication programme person making application required case application section 45(2)(b) participate provision approved programme education education (c) requisite knowledge skill purpose section 45(2) (a) (b) case may be recognition qualification veterinary specialist-part register

title: PRACTITIONER) REGULATIONS 2022
heading: 11. An applicant for registration as a veterinary specialist must satisfy the
text_raw:
11. An applicant for registration as a veterinary specialist must satisfy the 
Council that he or she has the requisite qualifications by providing evidence to 
the Council that he or she — 

(a) has been awarded the requisite title and qualification in the 

prescribed specialty regulations; 

(b) 

(c) 

is a person entitled to be registered under section 47 of the Act 
and/or the equivalent provisions in the regulations of 2017; or 

has undergone programmes of training and education, passed 
examinations and obtained qualifications which the Council 
determines are of a standard that is not lower than the standard 
of such programmes, examinations or qualifications prescribed 
in the speciality regulations necessary for the practice of the 
relevant speciality; and 

(d) 

is registered in Part A of the register as a veterinary practitioner. 

Manner and form of application for registration in Parts A, C and D of the 
register
text_norm: 11 applicant registration veterinary specialist must satisfy council requisite qualification providing evidence council -- (a) awarded requisite title qualification prescribed specialty regulation (b) (c) person entitled registered section 47 act equivalent provision regulation 2017 undergone programme training education passed examination obtained qualification council determines standard lower standard programme examination qualification prescribed speciality regulation necessary practice relevant speciality (d) registered part register veterinary practitioner manner form application registration part c register

title: PRACTITIONER) REGULATIONS 2022
heading: 12. An application for registration in the register shall be made in such
text_raw:
12. An application for registration in the register shall be made in such 
manner and form, including by electronic means, as may be published by the 
Council from time to time, and shall include: 

 
 
 
 
 8 [282] 

(a) personal information in relation to the applicant, together with 
the appropriate evidence and or documentation as specified by 
the Council including: 

(i) 

first name(s) and surname(s); 

(ii) 

if applicable, any other name by which the applicant is 
known; 

(iii) 

date and place of birth; 

(iv) 

nationality; 

(v) 

gender; 

(vi) 

postal address for correspondence; 

(vii) 

email address for correspondence; 

(viii) contact telephone number(s); 

(ix) 

languages spoken; 

(x) 

if applicable, place of work and position held. 

(b) details of qualifications, together with the appropriate evidence 

and or documentation as specified by the Council; 

(c) 

in the case of an application for limited registration: 

(i) 

(ii) 

(iii) 

evidence that the person making the application is 
required 
in a disease eradication 
programme; or 

to participate 

to participate in the provision of approved programmes 
of education or further education; and 

evidence that he or she has the requisite knowledge and 
skill for this purpose. 

(d) details of the applicant’s registration history and professional 

experience, if applicable; 

(e) 

details of the applicant’s current employment status. Where the 
applicant is employed, to include, details of practitioner’s 
employment in a registered veterinary premises, State premises 
or an exempted premises; 

(f) 

a completed declaration as to English or Irish language 
competency if required by regulation 15; 

 
 [282] 9 

(g) 

(h) 

(i) 

(j) 

(k) 

(l) 

a completed fit and proper person declaration in accordance with 
regulation 17; 

a completed declaration that the practitioner will adhere to the 
standards for veterinary practitioners as may be published from 
time to time by the Council in the Code of Professional 
Conduct, 

a completed declaration in accordance with the indemnity 
regulations, 

a completed declaration that the practitioner will adhere to the 
continuing veterinary education regulations, 

a completed declaration that the practitioner will adhere to the 
premises accreditation regulations and ; 

a completed declaration that the veterinary practitioner will 
uphold the honour, dignity and integrity of the veterinary 
profession, and promote the welfare of animals entrusted to his 
or her care and abide by the rulings of the Veterinary Council; 

(m) 

In the case of an application for registration as a veterinary 
specialist, a declaration that the applicant is registered on Part A 
of the register as provided for in section 34(4)(a) of the Act. 

(n) 

any further information or documentation requested by the 
Council.

title: PRACTITIONER) REGULATIONS 2022
heading: 13. Where an applicant has held veterinary practitioner registration
text_raw:
13. Where an applicant has held veterinary practitioner registration 
previously with the Council or with any licensing or registration veterinary 
practitioner body, the application shall include, in addition to the matters 
required under regulation 12: 

(a) details of all veterinary practitioner registrations currently or 
previously held by the applicant, including, in the case of an 
applicant previously registered with the Council, the registration 
number associated with such registration; and 

(b) 

evidence of the applicant’s good standing or current professional 
status in relation to all veterinary practitioner registrations 
currently or previously held by the applicant.
text_norm: 13 applicant held veterinary practitioner registration previously council licensing registration veterinary practitioner body application shall include addition matter required regulation 12 (a) detail veterinary practitioner registration currently previously held applicant including case applicant previously registered council registration number associated registration (b) evidence applicant good standing current professional status relation veterinary practitioner registration currently previously held applicant

title: PRACTITIONER) REGULATIONS 2022
heading: 14. An application form for registration in a Part of the register shall be
text_raw:
14. An application form for registration in a Part of the register shall be 
completed in full and dated by the applicant, and the applicant shall pay the fee 
prescribed in the Council’s fees regulations. 

 
 
 
 10 [282] 

Language competence
text_norm: 14 application form registration part register shall completed full dated applicant applicant shall pay fee prescribed council fee regulation 10 282 language competence

title: PRACTITIONER) REGULATIONS 2022
heading: 15. (1) An applicant must complete a declaration as to English or Irish
text_raw:
15. (1) An applicant must complete a declaration as to English or Irish 
language competency in such form as may be specified by the Council from 
time to time. 

(2) An applicant shall not be registered in the register unless he or she 
provides, on request, acceptable evidence of language competence as 
determined by the Council from time to time and set out on the Council’s 
website. 

(3) This section does not apply to persons entitled to be registered under 

section 42. 

Temporary and Occasional Services-Registration in Part B of the register
text_norm: 15 (1) applicant must complete declaration english irish language competency form may specified council time time (2) applicant shall registered register unless provides request acceptable evidence language competence determined council time time set council website (3) section apply person entitled registered section 42 temporary occasional services-registration part b register

title: PRACTITIONER) REGULATIONS 2022
heading: 16. An application for registration in the register shall be made in such
text_raw:
16. An application for registration in the register shall be made in such 
manner and form as may be published by the Council from time to time, in 
accordance with the requirements of the regulations of 2017. 

Part 4 

Common Provisions for registration in Parts A, C and D of the register, 
Retention on the register and Removal of name from the register 

Fit and Proper Declaration
text_norm: 16 application registration register shall made manner form may published council time time accordance requirement regulation 2017 part 4 common provision registration part c register retention register removal name register fit proper declaration

title: PRACTITIONER) REGULATIONS 2022
heading: 17. (1) An applicant must complete a declaration to the effect that he or she
text_raw:
17. (1) An applicant must complete a declaration to the effect that he or she 
is a fit and proper person to engage in the practice of veterinary medicine in the 
State, in such form as may be specified by the Council from time to time. Such 
form shall include declarations that the applicant: 

(a) 

is of good character and repute and is not an undischarged 
bankrupt; 

(b) has not been convicted by a court in the State or elsewhere, of 
an offence that, in the opinion of the Council, is such to render 
the person unfit to practise veterinary medicine; 

(c) 

(d) 

is not aware of any prosecution(s) or disciplinary action pending 
in the State or in any other jurisdiction; and 

is not prohibited from practising or suspended from the practice 
of, veterinary medicine either under Part 7 of the Act or 
provisions corresponding to those contained in that Part in force 
in another state, by reason of a conviction for an offence, or 
serious misconduct in connection with the carrying out of 
professional duties as a veterinary practitioner. 

 
 
 
 
 (2) An applicant must provide such further information in relation to issues 
raised in the declaration referred to in paragraph (1) as may be requested by the 
Council. 

[282] 11 

Part 5 

Annual retention of registration in register 

Requirement to apply for retention of registration
text_norm: 17 (1) applicant must complete declaration effect fit proper person engage practice veterinary medicine state form may specified council time time form shall include declaration applicant (a) good character repute undischarged bankrupt (b) convicted court state elsewhere offence opinion council render person unfit practise veterinary medicine (c) (d) aware prosecution(s) disciplinary action pending state jurisdiction prohibited practising suspended practice veterinary medicine either part 7 act provision corresponding contained part force another state reason conviction offence serious misconduct connection carrying professional duty veterinary practitioner (2) applicant must provide information relation issue raised declaration referred paragraph (1) may requested council 282 11 part 5 annual retention registration register requirement apply retention registration

title: PRACTITIONER) REGULATIONS 2022
heading: 18. A registered person other than a person registered in Part B of the
text_raw:
18. A registered person other than a person registered in Part B of the 
register, shall on or before 31 December each year, apply for retention of his or 
her name in the register for the following year by: 

(a) paying the fee prescribed in the Council’s fees regulations; 

(b) 

applying for retention of his or her name in the register annually 
by way of the relevant retention form specified by the Council 
from time to time; and 

(c) 

furnishing a completed declaration in accordance with the 
indemnity regulations.
text_norm: 18 registered person person registered part b register shall 31 december year apply retention name register following year (a) paying fee prescribed council fee regulation (b) applying retention name register annually way relevant retention form specified council time time (c) furnishing completed declaration accordance indemnity regulation

title: PRACTITIONER) REGULATIONS 2022
heading: 19. Where a registered person applies to retain his or her registration after
text_raw:
19. Where a registered person applies to retain his or her registration after 
31 December as set out in regulation 18, an additional fee, as may be 
prescribed by the Council in the fees regulations, may become payable.
text_norm: 19 registered person applies retain registration 31 december set regulation 18 additional fee may prescribed council fee regulation may become payable

title: PRACTITIONER) REGULATIONS 2022
heading: 20. The Council shall not consider an application for retention to be valid
text_raw:
20. The Council shall not consider an application for retention to be valid 

without completion of the relevant form and payment of the relevant fees.
text_norm: 20 council shall consider application retention valid without completion relevant form payment relevant fee

title: PRACTITIONER) REGULATIONS 2022
heading: 21. The retention of a registered person’s name on the relevant Part(s) of
text_raw:
21. The retention of a registered person’s name on the relevant Part(s) of 
register shall be for the calendar year (01 January to 31 December) for which 
he or she has applied.
text_norm: 21 retention registered person name relevant part(s) register shall calendar year (01 january 31 december) applied

heading: 22. This Part shall not apply to a person registered in Part B of the register.
text_raw:
22. This Part shall not apply to a person registered in Part B of the register.

title: PRACTITIONER) REGULATIONS 2022
heading: 23. An application by a registered person for entry of additional
text_raw:
23. An application by a registered person for entry of additional 
qualifications in the register pursuant to section 50 of the Act, shall be made 
in such manner and form as may be published by the Council from time to 
time, including by electronic means, and shall be accompanied by the 
appropriate fee as prescribed in the Council's fees regulations.
text_norm: 23 application registered person entry additional qualification register pursuant section 50 act shall made manner form may published council time time including electronic mean shall accompanied appropriate fee prescribed council fee regulation

title: PRACTITIONER) REGULATIONS 2022
heading: 24. Where the Council decides to enter a qualification on the register, it
text_raw:
24. Where the Council decides to enter a qualification on the register, it 
shall send that registered person a certificate stating that such additional 
qualification has been entered in the register. 

Part 7 

Removal from the register
text_norm: 24 council decides enter qualification register shall send registered person certificate stating additional qualification entered register part 7 removal register

title: PRACTITIONER) REGULATIONS 2022
heading: 25. An application by a veterinary practitioner for the removal of his or her
text_raw:
25. An application by a veterinary practitioner for the removal of his or her 
name from one or more part(s) of the register, shall be made in such manner 
and form as may be published by the Council from time to time, including by 
electronic means.
text_norm: 25 application veterinary practitioner removal name one part(s) register shall made manner form may published council time time including electronic mean

title: PRACTITIONER) REGULATIONS 2022
heading: 26. The applicant shall pay the fee prescribed in the Council’s fees
text_raw:
26. The applicant shall pay the fee prescribed in the Council’s fees 

regulations. 

Part 8 

Use of contact details
text_norm: 26 applicant shall pay fee prescribed council fee regulation part 8 use contact detail

title: PRACTITIONER) REGULATIONS 2022
heading: 27. The Council, and any committee established by it under the Act, or the
text_raw:
27. The Council, and any committee established by it under the Act, or the 
Registrar may use any of the contact details provided by any person to the 
Council in the course of an application under these regulations, for the purpose 
of providing any information or formal notification to that person, as the 
Council considers necessary, to include information or a notification in relation 
to fitness to practise matters. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [282] 13 

Part 9 

Revocations and transitional provisions
text_norm: 27 council committee established act registrar may use contact detail provided person council course application regulation purpose providing information formal notification person council considers necessary include information notification relation fitness practise matter 282 13 part 9 revocation transitional provision

title: PRACTITIONER) REGULATIONS 2022
heading: 28. The Council will consider all applications under these regulations from
text_raw:
28. The Council will consider all applications under these regulations from 

the 1st July 2022. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Veterinary Council 

of Ireland, 

9 June, 2022. 

VIVIENNE DUGGAN, 

President. 

NIAMH MULDOON, 

Registrar. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 14 [282]

EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation). 

These Regulations set out the requirements regarding the registration of 
veterinary practitioners and recognition their qualifications and annual 
retention. The regulation also set out the requirements for the removal of 
veterinary practitioners from the register and the requirements for the entry of 
additional qualifications to the register. 

These Regulations may be cited as the Veterinary Council of Ireland 
(Recognition of Qualifications and Registration) (Veterinary Practitioner) 
Regulations 2022. 

These Regulations come into operation on the 1st July 2022.
